sentences: Jean Balissat (May 15, 1936 â€“ September 16, 2007) was a composer, a professor of music and the conductor of various Swiss orchestras.
Jean Balissat was born in Lausanne, Switzerland.
He studied counterpoint and harmony with Hans Haug in Lausanne.
In 1954, he moved to Geneva, where he studied the orchestration of Andre-Francois Marescotti and course management with Samuel Baud-Bovy.
He also studied percussion with Charles Peschier and the horn with Robert Faller.
Balissat died in September 2007 in Corcelles-le-Jorat, Switzerland.
